intro: Commicarpus coctoris, commonly known as the desert thornapple, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a hard capsule. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability. Its toxic alkaloids make it a plant of both ecological and medicinal interest.
